result.execSummary:
The defendant Brittany M Bayliss was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Fine is to be paid at $75 per month commencing 08-01-2016 and the 1st of each month thereafter until paid or serve 25 days jail as penalty for failure to pay.
Court waives DNA surcharge.
After 12 months and all fines/costs are paid and not further law violations, expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Brittany M Bayliss in court with attorney Thomas Patrick Grieve.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant entered a plea of guilty to count 2. Court conducted plea colloquy with defendant. Court found defendant guilty of count 2. Count 1 dismissed and read-in.  

Court orders a fine of $939.50.  Defendant to pay $75.00 month commencing August 1, 2016 and each month thereafter or serve 25 days jail as penalty for non payment of fine. 
After 12 months if fine and all costs are paid and no further law violations then:  Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.

Court waives the DNA Surcharge based on date of violation.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 8, 2016 at 09:00 am.
